title: How to Make Snickerdoodles with Sugar Cookie Mix

steps.headline: Mix the wet ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, beat the butter and egg with a stand or hand mixer.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Use a medium bowl to combine the flour and cookie mix with a metal wire whisk.

steps.headline: Incorporate the two bowls.
steps.description: Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring.

steps.headline: Create your cinnamon sugar mixture.
steps.description: Mix the 1/4 cup (50 grams) sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon together in a small bowl.

steps.headline: Form dough balls.
steps.description: Use a cookie scoop to form 1-inch (2.54 cm) balls.

steps.headline: Gently roll each ball into the cinnamon sugar.
steps.description: Place them on a parchment paper lined baking sheet, about two inches apart from each other.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for about 11 to 12 minutes.
Allow the cookies to cool.
steps.description: Leave them on the cookie sheet for a few minutes. This is to allow the cookies to actually "set" while still piping hot.

steps.headline: Dress them with additional cinnamon and sugar.
steps.description: Sprinkle the mixture before the cookies completely cool down.

steps.headline: Transfer the cookies to a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Decorate the cookies.
steps.description: Use the decorative icing tubes to draw designs on them for a finish touch.

text: Making the Dough Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).  Mix the wet ingredients. In a large bowl, beat the butter and egg with a stand or hand mixer. Mix the dry ingredients. Use a medium bowl to combine the flour and cookie mix with a metal wire whisk. Incorporate the two bowls. Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring. Baking the Cookies Create your cinnamon sugar mixture. Mix the 1/4 cup (50 grams) sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon together in a small bowl. Form dough balls. Use a cookie scoop to form 1-inch (2.54 cm) balls. Gently roll each ball into the cinnamon sugar. Place them on a parchment paper lined baking sheet, about two inches apart from each other. Bake the cookies for about 11 to 12 minutes.  Allow the cookies to cool. Leave them on the cookie sheet for a few minutes. This is to allow the cookies to actually "set" while still piping hot. Dress them with additional cinnamon and sugar. Sprinkle the mixture before the cookies completely cool down. Transfer the cookies to a wire cooling rack. Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes. Decorate the cookies. Use the decorative icing tubes to draw designs on them for a finish touch. Finished.
